intro: Pedicularis muliensis, commonly known as the Chinese flame vetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan and Yunnan in China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. It grows in rocky or alpine environments, often in shaded areas with poor soil. Its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
